recipes.title: Greek Salad
ingredients: 1 cup garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, sliced onion, halved tomatoes, halved black olives, and drained garbanzo beans.
Add minced garlic, pepper, and Greek seasoning to the salad.
Toss the ingredients together until well mixed.
Sprinkle feta cheese crumbles over the salad just before serving.
Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator for 15 minutes to blend flavors.

recipes.title: Fried Green Tomatoes
instructions: Season the flour with salt, ground pepper, and thyme in a shallow dish.
In another dish, mix the beaten eggs with milk.
Dip each tomato slice into the seasoned flour, then into the egg mixture, and finally coat evenly with yellow cornmeal.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Fry each coated tomato slice for 2-3 minutes per side or until golden brown and crispy.
Drain the fried tomatoes on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.title: Chicken Adobo
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
SautÃ© sliced onions and minced green chilies until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add diced grilled chicken breasts and quartered chicken livers to the skillet. Cook until livers are browned, about 6-7 minutes.
Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Pour soy sauce over the chicken and add 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and let simmer for 20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Stir in mayonnaise and butter just before serving to create a rich, glossy sauce.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Indian Flatbread (Roti/Chapati)
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine wheat flour and salt.
Add vegetable oil and mix until the flour mixture becomes crumbly.
Gradually add water and knead to form a smooth and elastic dough. Cover and let the dough rest for 20 minutes.
Divide the dough into 12 equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball.
Flatten a dough ball with your hands and roll it out on a lightly floured surface to a thin circle.
Heat a tava or skillet over medium-high heat. Place the rolled dough on the skillet and cook until bubbles form, about 1 minute.
Flip and cook the other side for another minute. Press gently with a cloth to puff up.
Remove from heat and cover with a cloth to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining dough.
Serve warm with curry or chutney.

recipes.title: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken thighs, cut into pieces
instructions: Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt, cayenne pepper, chili powder, ground cumin, lemon juice, and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shallots, onion, and garlic, cooking until onions are translucent.
Add marinated chicken and cook for 10 minutes, or until chicken is browned on all sides.
Stir in passata and water. Add bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove the bay leaf. Stir in butter and cream, cooking for another 10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.title: Jamaican Ginger Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C (350Â°F). Grease and flour a loaf pan.
In a mixing bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in grated ginger and vanilla extract.
In another bowl, whisk together flour, ground ginger, cinnamon, and baking powder.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the creamed mixture alternately with milk, beginning and ending with flour mixture.
Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth the top.
Bake in preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove and cool completely on a wire rack.
Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

recipes.title: Paella
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or paella pan over medium-high heat.
Add skirt steak, shrimp, and chorizo sausage. Cook until browned, about 8 minutes, then remove meat and shrimp from the pan.
In the same pan, sautÃ© onion, garlic, and jalapeno chili until onion is translucent.
Stir in paella rice, sea salt, black pepper, cilantro, parsley, and bay leaf. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add 4 cups of water and white vinegar to the pan. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Return meat and shrimp to the pan, stirring gently. Cover and let sit for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Italian Biscotti
ingredients: 1 cup white almond bark, chopped for melting
instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C (350Â°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together sugar, olive oil, eggs, vanilla extract, and almond extract.
In another bowl, combine flour and baking powder. Gradually add to the egg mixture, stirring until well incorporated.
Fold in pistachio nuts and dried cranberries.
Divide dough in half and form two logs on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
Cut logs into 1/2 inch thick diagonal slices. Lay slices flat on the baking sheet.
Bake for an additional 10 minutes on each side or until crisp.
Melt white almond bark and drizzle over the cooled biscotti. Let set before serving.

recipes.title: Tacos al Pastor
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Marinate pork with olive oil, salt, pepper, chopped pineapple, and jalapeno chili for at least 1 hour.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill pork slices until charred and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.
In a separate pan, sautÃ© poblano peppers and purple onion until softened.
Warm corn tortillas on the grill or in a dry skillet.
Assemble tacos by placing grilled pork, sautÃ©ed vegetables, and fresh pineapple on each tortilla.
Top with shredded lettuce, cheddar cheese, and chopped cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.

recipes.title: Bruschetta
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine chopped tomatoes, basil, parsley, minced garlic, olive oil, and kosher salt.
Let the mixture sit for 10 minutes to meld flavors.
Spoon the tomato mixture generously onto the toasted baguette slices.
Serve immediately or at room temperature.

recipes.title: Raspberry Lemon Yogurt Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease and flour a bundt pan.
In a large bowl, mix together eggs, sugar, and vegetable oil until smooth.
Add Greek yogurt and lemon curd, mix until well incorporated.
Sift in flour and baking powder, and mix until just combined.
Fold in raspberries gently to avoid crushing them.
Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool for 20 minutes before inverting onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.

recipes.title: Italian Chicken Marinade
instructions: In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, Zesty Italian dressing, and Italian seasoning.
Place chicken breasts in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over them.
Seal the bag and massage the marinade into the chicken to ensure even coating.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight for best flavor.
Grill or bake the marinated chicken until fully cooked and internal temperature reaches 165Â°F (74Â°C).

recipes.title: Thai Chili Lime Sauce
instructions: In a small bowl, dissolve sugar in lime juice.
Add finely chopped hot chilis and fish sauce, stirring to combine.
Adjust flavors to taste, adding more sugar or lime juice if needed.
Serve as a dipping sauce or dressing for salads, grilled meats, or seafood.

recipes.title: Vietnamese Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 tablespoons corn starch dissolved in 1/4 cup water
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry until it's nearly cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Add red bell pepper, yellow squash, and broccolini, continuing to stir-fry for another 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic chili sauce and chicken broth, bring to a simmer.
Add dissolved corn starch to the skillet, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens.
Finish with fresh lime juice and green onions, season with salt to taste.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

recipes.title: Thai Peanut Noodles with Shrimp and Pork
ingredients: 1/2 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat a drizzle of vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add pork and shrimp, cooking until pork is browned and shrimp is pink, about 4-5 minutes.
Stir in peanut butter, hoisin sauce, and water, mixing until smooth and heated through.
Add cooked noodles and beansprouts to the skillet, tossing to coat with the sauce.
Stir in roasted peanuts, chopped mint, cilantro, and Thai basil.
Serve hot, garnished with extra herbs if desired.

recipes.title: Pico de Gallo
ingredients: 2 jalapeno chilies, seeded and finely chopped
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine chopped tomatoes, onion, jalapenos, and cilantro.
Squeeze lime juice over the mixture and sprinkle with kosher salt.
Stir well to combine.
Let the mixture sit for 5 to 10 minutes to allow flavors to meld before serving.
Adjust salt or lime juice to taste if necessary.

recipes.title: Southern Potato Salad
ingredients: 2 pounds baking potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 15 minutes.
Drain potatoes and let them cool.
In a large bowl, combine cooled potatoes, chopped eggs, mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper.
Mix gently until all ingredients are well combined.
Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving to enhance the flavors.

recipes.title: Chinese Tofu and Vegetable Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 block extra firm tofu, drained and cubed
1 tablespoon arrowroot powder mixed with 2 tablespoons water
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add minced ginger and red curry paste, sautÃ© for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add tofu cubes and stir-fry until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add sliced peppers and broccoli, stir-fry for another 5 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce and the arrowroot powder mixture. Cook until the sauce thickens, about 2 minutes.
Sprinkle sesame seeds over the stir-fry before serving.

recipes.title: Linguine Puttanesca
instructions: Cook linguine according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, sautÃ© for 1 minute until garlic is fragrant.
Stir in marinara sauce, olives, capers, and lemon zest. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Toss the cooked linguine with the sauce. Heat through for 2 minutes to blend the flavors.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Beef Lo Mein
ingredients: 200g lo mein noodles, cooked according to package instructions
1/4 cup dried black mushrooms, rehydrated and sliced
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add flank steak and stir-fry until browned, about 3-4 minutes.
Add mushrooms, cabbage, and beansprouts, stir-fry for an additional 2 minutes.

Stir in cooked lo mein noodles, chicken broth, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, salt, and pepper. Toss everything together and cook for another 2 minutes until well mixed and heated through.
Garnish with chives and crushed peanuts before serving.

recipes.title: Shrimp and White Bean Soup
ingredients: 1 can Great Northern beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sage, sautÃ© for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 4-5 minutes.
Stir in Great Northern beans and season with salt and pepper.
Pour in enough water to cover the ingredients and bring to a simmer.
Cook for 20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Serve hot with a slice of toasted bread on the side.

recipes.title: Southern Black-Eyed Pea Dip
ingredients: 1 can black-eyed peas, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine black-eyed peas, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, green onions, minced garlic, chili powder, and cayenne pepper.
Mash lightly with a fork to blend while keeping some texture.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake at 375Â°F (190Â°C) for 15 minutes until hot and bubbly.
Serve warm with tortilla chips.

recipes.title: Southern Collard Greens
ingredients: 2 pounds collard greens, stems removed and leaves chopped
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
instructions: In a large pot, heat extra-virgin olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and cook until onion is translucent.
Add ham hock, apple cider, chicken stock, brown sugar, cayenne pepper, chile powder, and bay leaves.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Add collard greens to the pot, season with salt and pepper, and simmer for another hour until the greens are tender and flavorful.
Remove the ham hock and bay leaves before serving.

recipes.title: Italian Hoagie Sandwich
ingredients: 8 slices Oscar Mayer Deli Fresh Smoked Ham
instructions: Spread softened butter on the inside of each hoagie roll and sprinkle with Italian seasoning.
Layer each roll with smoked ham, salami, pepperoni, and mozzarella cheese.
Top with chopped giardiniera.
Broil sandwiches in the oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 3-5 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Mexican Chicken Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Heat canola oil in a skillet over medium heat and sautÃ© garlic and green pepper until softened.
Add shredded chicken, black beans, and picante sauce to the skillet, stirring to combine.
Warm corn tortillas in the microwave or on a skillet to make them pliable.
Dip each tortilla in enchilada sauce, then fill with the chicken mixture, rolling tightly.
Place rolled enchiladas in a baking dish. Top with remaining enchilada sauce and shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve topped with shredded lettuce, sliced green onions, and a dollop of sour cream.

recipes.title: Indian Salmon Curry
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeds until they start to pop.
Add shallots, ginger, and serrano chile, sautÃ©ing until shallots are translucent.
Stir in curry powder and tomato sauce, bring to a simmer.
Season salmon fillets with salt and gently place them in the skillet. Cover and simmer for 10-12 minutes, until salmon is cooked through.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.

recipes.title: Mexican Chicken Tomato Salad
ingredients: 2 chicken breast halves, cooked and sliced
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together white vinegar, vegetable oil, salt, and black pepper.
Add tomatoes, jalapeno, onion, and cilantro to the dressing, tossing to coat.
Arrange lettuce leaves on plates. Top with the tomato mixture and sliced chicken.
Garnish with avocado slices and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Chinese Mandarin Orange Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease and flour a cake pan.
In a large bowl, combine cake mix, eggs, vegetable oil, water, and orange liqueur. Beat until smooth.
Fold in mandarin oranges and white sugar.
Pour batter into prepared cake pan and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool completely and frost with your choice of frosting.

recipes.title: Thai Lemongrass Coconut Soup
instructions: In a large pot, heat sesame oil over medium heat and sautÃ© garlic, ginger, and lemongrass until aromatic.
Add spareribs and brown slightly. Stir in tamari soy sauce, brown sugar, and dry sherry.
Pour in boiling water and coconut milk. Bring to a simmer.
Add rice and simmer for about 40 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the ribs are cooked through.
Stir in peanut sauce before serving. Adjust seasoning with additional soy sauce or sugar if needed.

recipes.title: Indian Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat vegetable oil and ghee in a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds until they begin to pop.
Add onions, garlic, ginger, and chile pepper. Cook until onions are golden.
Stir in tomato paste, chopped tomatoes, garam masala, and turmeric. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add chicken legs and coat evenly with the spice mixture. Pour in water, bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 30 minutes.
Uncover and simmer for another 15 minutes or until the chicken is tender and the sauce has thickened.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.

recipes.title: Jamaican Beef Patties
instructions: For the dough, combine flour, turmeric, salt, paprika, and butter in a bowl. Rub together until crumbly. Gradually add cold water until a dough forms. Chill for 30 minutes.
For the filling, heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook onions, garlic, and celery until soft. Add minced beef, thyme, ginger, curry powder, and black pepper. Cook until browned.
Pour in beef stock and water, simmer until the liquid is mostly absorbed. Allow to cool.
Roll out dough and cut into circles. Spoon beef mixture onto half of each circle, fold over and seal edges.
Bake at 375Â°F (190Â°C) for 25 minutes or until golden.

recipes.title: Italian Pork Ragu with Pappardelle
ingredients: 1 pound boneless pork loin, cut into chunks
Salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add pork and brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add onion, garlic, and rosemary. SautÃ© until onion is translucent.
Return pork to the pot, add crushed tomatoes, and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook on low heat for 1.5 hours or until the pork is tender.
Serve over cooked pappardelle, garnished with Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Thai Red Curry with Tofu and Vegetables
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and sautÃ© until soft.
Stir in red curry paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add coconut milk, bringing to a simmer. Add tofu, bell pepper, and eggplant. Cook until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.
Stir in fresh basil just before serving. Serve hot over rice or noodles.

recipes.title: Korean Beef Bibimbap
ingredients: 1 pound top round steak, thinly sliced
instructions: Cook Jasmine rice according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat. Add garlic, scallions, and steak. Cook until steak is browned.
Add shiitake mushrooms, bok choy, carrots, and beansprouts. Stir-fry until vegetables are tender.
Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and gochujang base in a small bowl. Pour over the stir-fry and mix well.
Serve the stir-fry over cooked rice, garnished with sesame seeds.

recipes.title: French Vanilla Custard
instructions: In a saucepan, combine milk and vanilla bean. Bring to a simmer over medium heat.
In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks, sugar, and corn starch until smooth.
Gradually pour hot milk into the egg mixture, whisking constantly.
Return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over low heat, stirring continuously, until the custard thickens and coats the back of a spoon.
Remove from heat and strain through a fine sieve to remove any lumps. Chill before serving.

recipes.title: French Pumpkin Cheesecake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
Mix gingersnap crumbs with melted butter and press into the bottom of a springform pan to form a crust.
In a bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add pumpkin purÃ©e, marshmallow creme, orange juice concentrate, maple syrup, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Beat until well combined.
Pour filling over the crust and smooth the top.
Bake for 50 minutes or until set. Cool, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Garnish with toasted pecans before serving.

recipes.title: Southern Green Beans with Bacon
instructions: In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside.
In the same skillet with bacon grease, add green beans, salt, pepper, white sugar, and brown sugar. Stir to coat.
Pour in white vinegar and cook, covered, over low heat for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add bacon back to the skillet and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Spanish Ham and Cheese Sandwich (Montadito)
instructions: Butter one side of each slice of bread. Spread Dijon mustard on the opposite side.
On the mustard side, layer a slice of Manchego cheese, Serrano ham, and a slice of membrillo.
Top with another slice of bread, buttered side out.
Grill the sandwich in a skillet over medium heat until the bread is golden and the cheese is melted, about 3 minutes per side.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Indian Chickpea and Spinach Burgers
instructions: In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except burger buns, mixed greens, and olive oil. Mix thoroughly to form a cohesive burger mixture.
Form into patties and cook in a lightly oiled skillet over medium heat, flipping once, until golden and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side.
Serve on buns with mixed greens.

recipes.title: Southern Fried Catfish
instructions: In a shallow bowl, mix flour, cornmeal, garlic powder, thyme, red pepper, salt, and black pepper.
In another bowl, whisk together eggs and buttermilk.
Dip each fillet in the buttermilk mixture, then dredge in the flour mixture, coating thoroughly.
Heat peanut oil in a large skillet and fry the fillets until golden brown and crispy, about 4 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.title: Indian Cauliflower and Potato Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, ginger, and green chilies; sautÃ© until onions are translucent.
Add cumin, coriander, and garam masala; cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add cauliflower and potatoes, stirring to coat with spices.
Pour in water and coconut milk, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Season with salt, serve over basmati rice, garnished with cilantro.

recipes.title: Italian Blood Orange and Fennel Salad
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
instructions: In a salad bowl, combine blood orange segments, sliced fennel, and olives.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss gently to combine and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Italian Balsamic Chicken with Dijon Sauce
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 1 tablespoon white wine vinegar
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and dried basil.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until golden on each side and cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and set aside.
Add garlic to the skillet and sautÃ© for 1 minute. Add balsamic vinegar, chicken broth, and Dijon mustard. Bring to a simmer.
Mix cornstarch and white wine vinegar; stir into the skillet. Cook until the sauce thickens, about 2 minutes.
Return chicken to the skillet, spoon sauce over the chicken, and cook for another 2 minutes to reheat the chicken.
Serve chicken with the balsamic Dijon sauce drizzled over the top.

recipes.title: Italian Mini Veggie Pizzas
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Spray a baking sheet with vegetable oil cooking spray.
Place toasted English muffin halves on the baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over each muffin half.
Top with chopped onions, green bell peppers, shredded carrots, and spinach.
Sprinkle mozzarella cheese and Italian seasoning over the top.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.title: Japanese Tempura Prawns
instructions: In a large bowl, mix rice flour, seasoning salt, salt, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper.
Gradually add chilled club soda to the dry ingredients, stirring until the batter is smooth.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Dip prawns into the batter to coat completely, then carefully drop into the hot oil.
Fry for 2-3 minutes or until golden and crispy.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.

recipes.title: Italian Chicken Ranch Lasagna
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
In a bowl, mix ranch dressing, evaporated milk, and pepper.
In a greased baking dish, layer lasagna noodles, ranch mixture, chicken, and both cheeses.
Repeat layering until all ingredients are used, finishing with a layer of cheese on top.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until the lasagna is bubbly and golden brown.

recipes.title: Greek Pork Souvlaki
ingredients: 1 pound boneless chop pork, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: In a bowl, combine olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, minced garlic, and oregano.
Add pork cubes to the marinade and let sit in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
Thread pork onto skewers.
Grill over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until pork is cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.

recipes.title: Korean Beef Tacos
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, lime juice, garlic, and chile paste.
Add sliced steak to the marinade and let sit for at least 15 minutes.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and spray with cooking spray.
Remove steak from marinade and cook in skillet until browned and cooked through.
Serve on warmed tortillas with shredded cabbage and sprinkle with green onions.

recipes.title: Indian Barley Pilaf with Raisins and Almonds
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add onions and garlic, sautÃ© until translucent.
Stir in barley, curry powder, salt, and pepper, and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until barley is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 30 minutes.
Stir in raisins, almonds, and parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Mexican S'mores
instructions: Preheat a grill or campfire to medium heat.
Place a piece of chocolate on one half of each graham cracker.
Roast marshmallows over the heat until golden brown and melty.
Place a roasted marshmallow on top of the chocolate and cover with the other half of the graham cracker.
Press gently to melt the chocolate with the warmth of the marshmallow. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Southern Cod and Potato Chowder
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion, celery, and bell peppers. Cook until softened.
Stir in flour, mustard powder, and Old Bay seasoning. Gradually add milk, stirring continuously until the mixture is smooth.
Add potatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Add cod and simmer until fish is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle bread crumbs on top before serving.

recipes.title: Irish Tea Brack
instructions: In a large bowl, combine brewed tea, golden raisins, raisins, currants, and candied orange peel. Let soak overnight.
Preheat oven to 325Â°F (165Â°C). Grease a loaf pan with cooking spray.
Stir dark brown sugar, flour, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, mace, and salt into the soaked fruit mixture.
Add rum extract, lemon zest, beaten eggs, and melted margarine. Mix until well combined.
Pour into the prepared loaf pan and bake for 1.5 hours or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan before slicing.

recipes.title: Korean Jajangmyeon (Black Bean Noodles)
ingredients: 1/2 pound pork, cut into small pieces
1 tablespoon corn starch, dissolved in 2 tablespoons water
instructions: Cook noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add pork and cook until browned.
Add onions and potato, cooking until tender.
Stir in black bean sauce, water, sugar, and salt. Bring to a simmer.
Add bok choy and simmer until tender.
Stir in dissolved corn starch and cook until sauce thickens.
Serve the sauce over the noodles.

recipes.title: Chinese Pork Egg Rolls
ingredients: 2 tablespoons corn starch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
instructions: In a large skillet, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add pork, garlic, and ginger, cooking until pork is no longer pink.
Add cabbage, carrots, and mushrooms. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Stir in soy sauce, rice wine, sesame oil, sugar, salt, and pepper. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Let filling cool. Place about 2 tablespoons of filling on each egg roll wrapper, roll tightly, and seal edges with corn starch mixture.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375Â°F (190Â°C). Fry egg rolls until golden brown and crispy, about 3 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.title: Mexican Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 jalapeno chili, seeded and finely chopped
instructions: Rinse quinoa under cold water until water runs clear. Place quinoa and vegetable broth in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until quinoa is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, jalapeno, garlic, lime juice, olive oil, diced tomatoes, and cilantro. Mix well.
Season with kosher salt and adjust flavors as needed. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.title: Southern Okra and Bell Pepper Saute
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add okra and bell peppers. Saute until vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.

recipes.title: Chinese Braised Duck with Orange Sauce
ingredients: 1 whole duck, cleaned and cut into pieces
instructions: In a large pot, brown duck pieces over medium heat. Remove duck and set aside.
In the same pot, saute onion, garlic, and ginger until onion is translucent.
Add back the duck along with orange juice, zest, soy sauce, brown sugar, five-spice powder, star anise, and water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1.5 hours, or until the duck is tender.
Adjust salt and sauce thickness as desired. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Moroccan Lamb Pasta Bake
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add lamb, onion, and garlic, cooking until lamb is browned.
Stir in cumin, cinnamon, and ras el hanout. Add tomatoes and tomato paste, simmer for 10 minutes.
In a separate saucepan, whisk together milk and flour. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in Parmesan cheese.
In a large bowl, combine cooked pasta, lamb mixture, cheese sauce, and beaten eggs. Mix well.
Pour into a baking dish, top with feta cheese and mint flakes.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until set and golden on top.

recipes.title: Irish Blue Cheese Scones
ingredients: 1 large egg white, beaten for brushing
instructions: Preheat oven to 400Â°F (200Â°C). Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.
In a bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Mix well.
In another bowl, whisk together vegetable oil, milk, and egg. Stir into the flour mixture until just moistened.
Fold in blue cheese.
Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead gently. Roll dough to 1-inch thickness and cut with a biscuit cutter.
Place scones on the prepared baking sheet. Brush tops with beaten egg white.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Chinese Soy Sauce Chicken with Cucumber Salad
instructions: In a large pot, combine soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, and chili peppers. Add chicken leg quarters and enough water to cover.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 40 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
In a bowl, mix sliced cucumber with rice vinegar, salt, and pepper. Let marinate while chicken cooks.
Remove chicken from the pot and brush with butter. Broil for 3-5 minutes until the skin is crispy.
Serve chicken on Napa cabbage leaves, accompanied by cucumber salad and steamed rice.

recipes.title: Irish Bacon and Sausage Sheet Pan Dinner
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400Â°F (200Â°C).
On a large baking sheet, toss baby potatoes and onion slices with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Arrange sausages and bacon on the sheet pan.
Roast in the oven for 30 minutes, turning halfway through, until sausages are cooked and vegetables are tender.
Pour chicken stock over the sheet pan in the last 5 minutes of cooking.
Sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving alongside crusty bread.

recipes.title: Mexican Hibiscus Tea (Agua de Jamaica)
instructions: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add hibiscus flowers, piloncillo, cinnamon stick, cloves, allspice, and nutmeg.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Strain the mixture into a pitcher, discarding solids. Sweeten with additional sugar if desired.
Chill in the refrigerator. Serve cold over ice.

recipes.title: Italian Garlic Herb Infused Olive Oil
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Heat over low heat until just starting to simmer.
Remove from heat and let cool completely.
Strain oil through a fine mesh sieve into a clean bottle or jar. Discard herbs and garlic.
Use the infused oil for dipping bread, drizzling over salads, or cooking.

recipes.title: Italian Kahlua Tiramisu
ingredients: Chocolate covered coffee beans for garnish
instructions: Dissolve espresso granules in boiling water, mix with cold water and KahlÃºa. Set aside.
Beat egg yolks and sugar until thick. Stir in mascarpone and gelatin prepared according to package directions.
In another bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold into mascarpone mixture.
Whip cream until stiff and fold into the mascarpone mixture.
Quickly dip pound cake slices into the coffee mixture, layer in a dish.
Spread a layer of the mascarpone mixture over the cake. Repeat layers, finishing with the mascarpone mixture.
Melt chocolate morsels with butter, drizzle over the top. Chill for at least 4 hours.
Garnish with chocolate-covered coffee beans before serving.

recipes.title: Italian Spring Vegetable Risotto
ingredients: 4 cups low salt chicken broth, warmed
instructions: In a large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sautÃ© until translucent.
Add Arborio rice, stirring to coat with oil. Pour in white wine, cook until evaporated.
Add chicken broth one cup at a time, stirring constantly, until each addition is absorbed before adding the next.
Halfway through, add carrots, squash, zucchini, and asparagus. Continue cooking and adding broth.
Stir in frozen peas and cook until all liquid is absorbed and rice is creamy.
Remove from heat, stir in pine nuts, basil, Parmesan cheese, and butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with extra Parmesan if desired.

recipes.title: Jamaican Coconut Chicken and Rice
ingredients: 1 can red beans, drained and rinsed
Salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, celery, and carrots. Cook until vegetables are soft.
Add chicken thighs and brown on both sides. Stir in coconut milk, water, tomato sauce, chipotle, and thyme. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook for 30 minutes or until chicken is tender. Add red beans and rice, cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Stir in lime juice and zest. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro, avocado slices, and lime wedges.

recipes.title: Mexican Beef Enchilada Casserole
ingredients: 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
12 corn tortillas, torn into bite-sized pieces
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
In a skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat. Drain excess fat.
Stir in both soups, salsa, taco seasoning, and water. Bring to a simmer.
In a baking dish, layer half the torn tortillas, followed by half the beef mixture, and then half the cheese. Repeat layers.
Bake for 20 minutes or until bubbly and cheese is melted.

recipes.title: Japanese Tonkatsu (Deep-Fried Pork Cutlet)
instructions: Season pork steaks with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat with panko breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
Fry pork cutlets until golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with a side of cabbage slaw or rice.

recipes.title: Spanish Garlic Shrimp (Gambas al Ajillo)
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and chorizo, cooking until chorizo is crispy.
Increase heat to high, add shrimp and bell pepper. Cook until shrimp turn pink and are cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
Pour in pineapple juice, dark rum, lime juice, and lemon juice. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, allowing the sauce to slightly reduce.
Remove from heat, garnish with cilantro, and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Thai Cashew Chicken with Green Curry
ingredients: 1 pound chicken tenderloin, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic, sautÃ© until softened.
Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through and lightly browned.
Stir in green curry paste, soy sauce, kecap manis, Sriracha, and chili flakes. Cook for 5 minutes to blend the flavors.
Add cashews and broad beans, cook for another 5 minutes until beans are heated through.
Remove from heat, stir in basil leaves. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Southern Cajun Shrimp and Cauliflower Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion and mushrooms, sautÃ© until tender.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, mix condensed cheese soup, milk, Creole seasoning, paprika, cayenne, and black pepper.
In a baking dish, layer cauliflower, then the shrimp mixture. Pour soup mixture over the top.
Bake for 25 minutes until bubbly.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Spanish Cinnamon Flan
instructions: In a saucepan, combine milk with cinnamon stick, bring to a simmer over medium heat.
In a bowl, mix sugar, ground cinnamon, and cornflour. Add egg yolks and whisk until smooth.
Slowly add the hot milk to the egg mixture, whisking continuously.
Return mixture to the saucepan and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.
Pour into ramekins and chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.

recipes.title: French Asparagus and Bacon Quiche
ingredients: 1 bunch asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Place pie crust in a pie dish. Prick the bottom with a fork.
Blanch asparagus in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, Parmesan, salt, and pepper.
Spread asparagus, bacon, and green onions in the pie crust. Pour egg mixture over the top.
Bake for 35-40 minutes until the quiche is set and golden brown.
Let cool for 10 minutes before slicing.

recipes.title: Italian Spinach and Tortellini Salad
ingredients: 1 package cheese tortellini, cooked and cooled
2 cups fresh leaf spinach, washed and trimmed
1/2 cup navy beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine tortellini, spinach, cherry tomatoes, navy beans, and capers.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently to combine.
Garnish with chopped basil and shaved Parmesan cheese before serving.

recipes.title: Indian Apple and Quinoa Curry
ingredients: 2 Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, and diced
instructions: In a large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sautÃ© until softened.
Stir in curry powder and paprika, cook for 1 minute.
Add quinoa and chicken broth, bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in apples and continue to cook until quinoa is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 10 more minutes.
Stir in milk, season with salt, and cook until heated through.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro if desired.

recipes.title: British Yorkshire Pudding
instructions: Preheat oven to 425Â°F (220Â°C).
Place a teaspoon of lard in each well of a 12-cup muffin tin. Place in oven to melt lard and get very hot.
In a bowl, whisk together flour, salt, eggs, and milk until smooth.
Carefully remove the hot tin from the oven. Pour the batter evenly into the wells, filling them half full.
Bake for 20 minutes or until the puddings have puffed up and are golden brown.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Spanish Tomato and Bell Pepper Salad
ingredients: Salt and ground pepper to taste
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine tomatoes, bell peppers, green onions, golden raisins, and olives.
Drizzle with olive oil and white wine vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper, and toss gently to combine.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.

recipes.title: Italian Fava Bean and Sausage Lasagna
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add sausage, onion, and garlic. Cook until sausage is browned.
Add fava beans, tomatoes, white wine, and crushed red pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes until thickened.
Layer a baking dish with lasagna sheets, sausage mixture, and a sprinkle of Pecorino Romano. Repeat layers.
Bake in a preheated 375Â°F (190Â°C) oven for 30 minutes, or until bubbly and golden.
Allow to rest for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Korean Egg Drop Soup
instructions: In a pot, bring chicken broth to a simmer.
Slowly pour in beaten eggs while stirring the broth gently to form thin strands of egg.
Stir in sesame oil, fish sauce, and green onions.
Simmer for an additional 3 minutes. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Indian Lentil and Sweet Potato Curry
instructions: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook until onion is translucent.
Stir in curry paste, cook for 1 minute. Add sweet potatoes, lentils, vegetable stock, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes, or until lentils and potatoes are tender.
Stir in spinach, lime zest, and lime juice. Cook until spinach is wilted.
Remove from heat, stir in yogurt, and season with salt.
Serve hot over basmati rice.

recipes.title: Mexican Chicken Posole
ingredients: 2 dried chile peppers, seeded and chopped
Kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste
For garnish: sliced radishes, chopped cabbage, diced avocado, lime wedges, tortilla chips, cilantro leaves
instructions: In a large pot, heat canola oil over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, and red bell pepper. SautÃ© until soft.
Add dried chile peppers and tomato paste. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Place chicken breasts in the pot and pour in chicken stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Remove chicken from the pot, let cool slightly, then shred the meat, discarding the bones.
Return shredded chicken to the pot. Add hominy and oregano. Season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for an additional 30 minutes. Adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve hot, garnished with radishes, cabbage, avocado, lime wedges, tortilla chips, and cilantro.

recipes.title: Mexican Meringue Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°F (95Â°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a clean, dry bowl, beat egg whites until soft peaks form.
Gradually add sugar, continuing to beat until the mixture is glossy and stiff peaks form.
Spoon or pipe the meringue onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 1.5 hours, or until meringues are dry and crisp.
Cool on a wire rack and store in an airtight container.

recipes.title: Southern Layered Chocolate Delight
ingredients: 1 package (3.4 ounces) instant butterscotch pudding mix
1 container (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed
instructions: In a bowl, mix graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a 9x13 inch dish to form a crust.
In another bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Spread over the crust.
In a separate bowl, whisk together pudding mixes and milk until thickened. Spread over the cream cheese layer.
Top with whipped topping. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

recipes.title: French Fennel and Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) Great Northern beans, drained and rinsed
1/2 cup Kalamata olives, pitted and halved
instructions: In a salad bowl, combine beans, sliced fennel, olives, and capers.
In a small bowl, whisk together red wine vinegar, oregano, fennel seeds, salt, pepper, and olive oil.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.

recipes.title: Cajun Creole Jambalaya
ingredients: 1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add kielbasa and cook until browned.
Add onion, celery, bell pepper, and garlic. Cook until vegetables are softened.
Stir in rice, chicken broth, cayenne pepper, and Creole seasoning. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until shrimp are pink and rice is tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in fresh parsley just before serving.

recipes.title: Italian Penne Pasta with Marinara Sauce
instructions: Cook penne pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water according to package instructions until al dente. Drain.
In a separate saucepan, heat marinara sauce over medium heat until hot.
Toss cooked pasta with the hot marinara sauce.
Serve topped with shredded mozzarella and fresh basil.

recipes.title: Italian Chickpea Soup
instructions: Drain soaked chickpeas and place them in a large pot with 8 cups of water, bay leaves, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour, or until chickpeas are tender.
In another pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions, carrots, celery, and garlic. Cook until vegetables are soft.
Add tomatoes and red pepper flakes to the pot with vegetables, cook for 10 minutes.
Add cooked vegetables to the pot with chickpeas. Simmer for another 30 minutes.
Remove bay leaves, stir in parsley, and season with salt. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Italian Tiramisu
ingredients: 1 cup strong brewed coffee, mixed with 2 tablespoons KahlÃºa
1 angel food cake, cut into cubes
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together mascarpone, yogurt, milk, sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Dip angel food cake cubes briefly into the coffee mixture, then layer them in a serving dish.
Spread a layer of the mascarpone mixture over the soaked cake.
Repeat layering, finishing with a layer of the mascarpone mixture.
Sift cocoa powder over the top and garnish with shaved chocolate.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

recipes.title: Southern Fried Chicken
instructions: Marinate chicken in buttermilk for at least 30 minutes.
In a shallow bowl, mix flour, corn starch, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and cayenne.
In another bowl, beat eggs.
Dip chicken in egg, then dredge in flour mixture.
Heat peanut oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
Fry chicken until golden brown and cooked through, about 10 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.title: Greek Fig and Orange Honey Gelatin
instructions: In a saucepan, combine Zinfandel, honey, sugar, orange juice, lemon juice, cinnamon, clove, and star anise. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle gelatin over 1/2 cup water in a bowl; let stand for 5 minutes to soften.
Remove the spice-infused wine from heat, discard cinnamon, clove, and anise, and stir in softened gelatin until dissolved.
Arrange figs in a mold, pour the gelatin mixture over, and refrigerate until set, about 3 hours.
Whip cream to soft peaks, fold in yogurt, and serve with the set gelatin.

recipes.title: Japanese Beef and Daikon Stew
ingredients: 1 pound chuck roast, cut into cubes
2 tablespoons corn starch, mixed with 2 tablespoons water
Salt and ground pepper to taste
Sliced green onions and chopped cilantro for garnish
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add beef cubes and sprinkle with flour. Brown the beef on all sides.
Add onions, garlic, and ginger. Cook until onions are translucent.
Pour in beef stock, mirin, and soy sauce. Add star anise and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1 hour or until beef is tender.
Add daikon and shiitake mushrooms, simmer for an additional 30 minutes.
Stir in corn starch mixture to thicken the stew. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with green onions and cilantro.

recipes.title: Cajun Creole Catfish with Coleslaw
instructions: Preheat oven to 425Â°F (220Â°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray with cooking spray.
In a shallow dish, mix crushed Corn Flakes, cornmeal, and Creole seasoning.
Dredge catfish fillets in the mixture, coating evenly.
Place coated fillets on the prepared baking sheet. Spray the tops with cooking spray.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until fish is cooked through and the coating is crispy.
Serve hot with a side of coleslaw.

recipes.title: Korean Spicy Pork Stir-Fry
instructions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, chili paste, brown sugar, honey, red pepper flakes, mashed kiwi, grated pear, garlic, and ginger to make a marinade.
Add pork slices to the marinade and let sit for at least 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add marinated pork and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions if desired.

recipes.title: Mexican Swiss Chard and Cheese Enchiladas
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, cook until translucent.
Add Swiss chard and cook until wilted. Season with salt and red pepper flakes.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet to make them pliable.
Fill each tortilla with the Swiss chard mixture and a sprinkle of queso fresco. Roll up and place seam side down in a baking dish.
Pour chicken broth over the enchiladas and top with salsa.
Bake in a preheated 375Â°F (190Â°C) oven for 20 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with additional queso fresco and chopped cilantro.

recipes.title: French Potato Gratin
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
In a large bowl, toss the sliced potatoes with salt and pepper.
Arrange a layer of potatoes in a greased baking dish. Pour some of the heavy cream over the layer and sprinkle with some of the GruyÃ¨re cheese.
Repeat layering until all ingredients are used, finishing with a layer of cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden and bubbly.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Japanese Miso Udon Soup
instructions: In a pot, bring the vegetable broth to a simmer. Add the carrots, mushrooms, and ginger. Cook for about 10 minutes.
Add the sake and continue to simmer for another 5 minutes.
Prepare the udon noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
Stir the miso paste into a small amount of the hot broth until dissolved, then return to the pot.
Add tofu and simmer gently for 5 minutes, being careful not to boil.
Divide the cooked noodles among bowls and pour the soup over them.
Garnish with green onions before serving.

recipes.title: Italian Sausage and Broccoli Rabe Stromboli
ingredients: 1 pound Italian sausage, removed from casings
1 bunch broccoli rabe, trimmed and chopped
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400Â°F (200Â°C).
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, sautÃ© for 1 minute.
Add sausage and cook until browned. Add broccoli rabe, salt, and pepper. Cook until the greens are wilted.
Roll out pizza dough into a rectangle on a floured surface. Spread the sausage mixture over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border. Sprinkle with both cheeses.
Roll up dough starting from the long side, sealing the edges. Place seam side down on a baking sheet.
Brush with beaten egg. Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown.
Let cool for 10 minutes before slicing.

recipes.title: Filipino Pickled Cucumber Salad
instructions: In a bowl, combine vinegar, sugar, fish sauce, sesame oil, salt, and peppercorns. Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Add cucumbers, onion, and Thai chile to the dressing. Toss to coat.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving to allow flavors to meld.

recipes.title: Southern Chicken Pot Pie
ingredients: 1 cup frozen peas and carrots, thawed
1 can (10.75 oz) cream of chicken soup
1 tablespoon mixed herbs (such as thyme, rosemary, sage)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine cream of chicken soup, chicken broth, white wine, and corn starch. Stir until smooth.
Add cooked chicken, peas and carrots, buttermilk, herbs, salt, and pepper to the soup mixture. Mix well.
Place one pie crust in a pie dish. Pour the chicken mixture into the crust.
Cover with the second pie crust, seal edges, and cut away excess dough. Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until crust is golden brown. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Italian Spinach and Ricotta Manicotti
ingredients: 1 package (10 oz) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well-drained
instructions: Cook manicotti shells according to package instructions. Drain and set aside to cool.
In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, 1 cup mozzarella, eggs, spinach, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Spray a baking dish with cooking spray and spread a thin layer of pasta sauce on the bottom.
Fill each manicotti shell with the cheese and spinach mixture and arrange in the baking dish.
Pour the remaining pasta sauce over the filled shells and sprinkle with the remaining mozzarella cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and golden.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Indian Rose and Almond Rice Pudding
ingredients: 1 tablespoon rose petals, edible and dried
instructions: Rinse the rice under cold water until water runs clear.
In a heavy-bottomed pot, combine rice, milk, and saffron. Bring to a simmer over low heat, stirring frequently to prevent sticking.
Cook until the rice is soft and the milk has reduced to a creamy consistency, about 30-35 minutes.
Add sugar, almonds, and pistachios. Cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Cool to room temperature, then chill in the refrigerator.
Serve chilled, garnished with rose petals.

recipes.title: Korean Honey Soy Chicken Wings
instructions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger to make the marinade.
Toss chicken wings in the marinade and let sit for at least 30 minutes.
Heat canola oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Dredge marinated wings in flour and fry until golden and crisp, about 8-10 minutes.
Whisk corn starch into the remaining marinade and bring to a boil in a small saucepan to thicken.
Toss fried wings in the thickened sauce and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Mexican Chipotle Chicken Chili
ingredients: 2 chipotle chiles in adobo sauce, chopped
Salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, and sautÃ© until translucent.
Add drumsticks and brown on all sides.
Stir in chipotle chiles, green chile, tomatoes, chicken stock, ancho powder, and chipotle chile powder. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 45 minutes.
Remove chicken, shred it, and return to the pot. Stir in corn meal to thicken the chili.
Simmer for an additional 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.

recipes.title: Mexican Beef Rib Tacos with Sriracha Lime Sauce
instructions: Season beef ribs with salt and brown in olive oil over high heat. Add beer, cover, and simmer for 1.5 hours or until tender.
Remove ribs, shred the meat, and set aside.
In a bowl, mix sriracha, lime juice, soy sauce, chili sauce, and brown sugar to make the sauce.
Warm tortillas, then build the tacos with shredded beef, sriracha lime sauce, cranberry sauce, cheddar cheese, avocado slices, and jalapeno.
Serve garnished with fresh cilantro.

recipes.title: Japanese Miso Soup
instructions: In a pot, bring water to a simmer and dissolve dashi granules in it.
Add seaweed and simmer for 5 minutes.
Reduce heat to low and stir in miso paste until fully dissolved.
Add tofu and continue to heat for another 3 minutes without boiling.
Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions.

recipes.title: Greek Spanakopita
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine spinach, feta, Myzithra, Kefalotyri, eggs, dill, onion, yoghurt, salt, and pepper.
Brush a baking dish with some olive oil. Lay a sheet of phyllo dough in the dish, brush with olive oil, and repeat layering until half the phyllo is used.
Spread the spinach and cheese mixture over the phyllo. Top with the remaining phyllo, brushing each sheet with olive oil.
Cut into squares before baking. Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until golden and crisp.
Let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Mexican Black-Eyed Pea Salsa
instructions: In a large bowl, combine black-eyed peas, onion, Monterey Jack cheese, cilantro, garlic, lime juice, canola oil, sriracha, and sea salt.
Mix well and adjust seasoning as needed.
Chill for at least 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve with tortilla chips.

recipes.title: Southern Fried Okra
instructions: In a bowl, soak okra in buttermilk for 10 minutes.
In another bowl, mix beaten eggs with flour, cracker crumbs, and salt.
Heat peanut oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Drain okra from buttermilk and dredge in the flour and crumb mixture.
Fry in batches until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per batch.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.title: Chinese Crab Rangoon
ingredients: 8 ounces crab meat, drained and flaked
instructions: In a bowl, mix crab meat, cream cheese, powdered sugar, garlic, and salt until well combined.
Place a teaspoon of the crab mixture in the center of each wonton wrapper.
Moisten edges of the wrapper with water, fold in a triangle, and press edges to seal.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Fry the wontons in batches until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.title: British Bubble and Squeak
ingredients: 4 cups cooked and mashed baking potatoes
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Mix the mashed potatoes and cabbage together and season with salt and pepper.
Press the mixture into the skillet, forming a large pancake.
Cook until the bottom is golden brown and crispy, about 8 minutes.
Flip over and cook the other side until browned, about another 8 minutes.
Serve hot, cut into wedges.

recipes.title: Japanese Chicken Karaage
ingredients: 1 pound boneless chicken thighs, cut into pieces
instructions: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, sake, sesame oil, and grated ginger. Add chicken pieces, mix well, and marinate for at least 1 hour.
Heat peanut oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
Dredge marinated chicken pieces in potato starch, shaking off excess.
Fry chicken in batches until golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.title: Italian Cannoli
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cold and diced
1/4 cup semi-sweet chocolate morsels, finely chopped
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, and salt. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually add white wine, mixing until dough forms. Wrap and chill for 30 minutes.
Roll dough out thinly and cut into circles. Wrap circles around cannoli forms.
Heat oil in a deep-fryer to 375Â°F (190Â°C). Fry shells until golden, about 2 minutes. Let cool and carefully remove forms.
For the filling, mix ricotta, cream cheese, confectioners' sugar, orange liqueur, and vanilla extract until smooth. Fold in chocolate and pistachios.
Pipe filling into cooled shells. Dust with extra confectioners' sugar and serve.

recipes.title: Mexican Pico de Gallo
instructions: In a bowl, combine tomatoes, onion, serrano peppers, and cilantro.
Add lime juice and salt to taste. Mix well.
Let sit for 10 minutes to allow flavors to meld before serving.

recipes.title: Irish Hazelnut Cherry Oatmeal
ingredients: 1 cup sweet cherries, pitted and halved
instructions: Bring water to a boil in a pot. Add oats and salt. Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in cinnamon, hazelnuts, and brown sugar. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in hazelnut oil and cherries.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Greek Lamb Burgers
instructions: In a bowl, mix ground lamb, mint, feta cheese, cinnamon, balsamic vinegar, salt, and paprika.
Form into 4 patties. Brush with olive oil.
Grill over medium heat for 5-6 minutes per side or until desired doneness.
Serve on buns with baby spinach and sliced onion.

recipes.title: Cajun Red Beans and Rice with Andouille Sausage
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add sausage and cook until browned.
Add onions, garlic, celery, and sweet peppers to the skillet. Cook until vegetables are soft.
Stir in kidney beans, diced tomatoes, and Cajun seasoning. Simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve the bean and sausage mixture over cooked rice.

recipes.title: Japanese Salmon Sushi Bowl
instructions: In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, wasabi, garlic, and grated ginger.
Arrange cooked sushi rice in bowls. Top with sliced salmon, drizzle with the soy sauce mixture.
Garnish with pickled ginger, black sesame seeds, and scallions.

recipes.title: Italian Beef and Porcini Mushroom Stew
ingredients: 2 pounds beef rib short, cut into chunks
1 cup dried porcini mushrooms, soaked and chopped
3 cups fat-free less sodium beef broth
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Dredge beef chunks in flour and brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add onions and garlic. Cook until softened. Stir in tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add red wine, scraping any browned bits off the bottom of the pot. Reduce by half.
Return beef to the pot, add both types of mushrooms, beef broth, and thyme. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 1.5 hours or until beef is tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Southern Fried Green Tomatoes with Spicy Remoulade
instructions: Dip tomato slices in buttermilk, then dredge in a mixture of flour, cracker crumbs, and Creole seasoning.
Heat oil in a skillet and fry tomatoes until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels.
For the remoulade, mix mayonnaise, mustard, horseradish, paprika, lemon juice, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve fried tomatoes with spicy remoulade sauce.

recipes.title: Southern Butternut Squash and Turnip Greens Salad
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive and vegetable oils over medium heat. Add butternut squash and sautÃ© until golden and tender.
In a large bowl, combine cooked squash, turnip greens, apple, and country ham.
In a small bowl, whisk together buttermilk, lemon juice, shallot, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Drizzle dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Southern Edamame and Corn Succotash
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and sautÃ© until translucent.
Add the edamame and corn to the skillet and cook until heated through, about 5-7 minutes.
Season with seasoning salt and stir well to combine.
Serve warm as a side dish.

recipes.title: Italian Cauliflower and Olive Pasta
ingredients: 1 can (14 oz) whole peeled tomatoes, crushed
instructions: Cook penne pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and crushed red pepper, sautÃ© for 1 minute.
Add cauliflower florets to the skillet and cook until slightly tender, about 8 minutes.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, olives, and capers. Cook for another 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Toss the cooked pasta with the cauliflower sauce. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with grated parmesan and chopped parsley.

recipes.title: Mexican Salsa Fresca
instructions: In a bowl, combine diced tomatoes, chopped onion, minced serrano, and chopped cilantro.
Add lime juice and salt. Mix well to combine.
Let the salsa sit for 10 minutes to allow flavors to meld before serving.

recipes.title: Indian Naan Bread
instructions: In a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, salt, and yeast. Add sunflower oil, yoghurt, and warm water. Mix to form a soft dough.

Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let rise in a warm place for about 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and knead in kalonji and minced garlic. Divide into 6 equal parts and roll each into a ball. Let them rest for 10 minutes.
Roll each ball into a thin oval shape. Heat a skillet and cook each naan for about 2 minutes on each side until puffed and golden.
Brush with melted butter and garnish with fresh coriander before serving.

recipes.title: Mexican Quinoa and Chicken Skillet
ingredients: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cubed
1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add onion, bell pepper, and jalapeno. SautÃ© until soft.
Stir in quinoa, chicken broth, and taco seasoning. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes.
Add cooked chicken, black beans, and salsa. Cook until heated through.
Top with shredded cheese and cover until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Mexican Tomatillo Salsa
instructions: Chop tomatillos and combine with jalapeno, onion, and cilantro in a food processor. Pulse until coarsely chopped.
Add lime juice and salt. Pulse again to mix.
Adjust seasoning to taste and serve with chips or as a condiment for tacos.

recipes.title: French Apple and Pinenut Galette
ingredients: 4 baking apples, peeled, cored, and sliced
1 large egg, beaten for egg wash
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Arrange pie crust on a baking sheet.
Toss apples with pinenuts, raisins, sugar, cinnamon, and Eau de vie if using. Arrange on the crust, leaving a 2-inch border.
Fold the edges of the crust over the filling, brush with egg wash, and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and a pinch of salt.
Bake for 45-50 minutes until crust is golden and filling is bubbly. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Irish Guinness Beef Stew with Soda Bread
instructions: For the stew: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Brown the steak cubes on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add onions, carrots, and cook until softened. Stir in tomato paste, flour, sugar, and dried rosemary.
Return the steak to the pot. Pour in the Guinness and beef stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours, or until the meat is tender.
Add potatoes and cook for an additional 30 minutes.
For the soda bread: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C). In a large bowl, mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, sugar, and rosemary.
Add buttermilk and melted butter, stirring just until the dough comes together.
Turn onto a floured surface, knead briefly, then form into a round loaf. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 40 minutes, or until golden.
Serve the stew hot with freshly baked soda bread.

recipes.title: Chinese Pork Wonton Soup
instructions: In a bowl, combine ground pork, green onions, water chestnuts, garlic, ginger, sesame oil, and soy sauce.
Place a teaspoon of pork mixture in the center of each wonton wrapper. Moisten edges with water, fold over the filling to form a triangle, and press edges to seal.
Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add wontons and cook for 5 minutes. Add Chinese cabbage and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve hot with dipping sauces.

recipes.title: Spanish Chickpea and Spinach Stew with Saffron
ingredients: 1 large bunch fresh spinach, washed and chopped
Salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sautÃ© until onion is translucent.
Stir in cumin, crushed red pepper, and saffron, cook for 1 minute.
Add chickpeas and dry sherry, cook until the sherry is nearly evaporated.
Add spinach and cook until it wilts. Stir in lemon juice and bread crumbs, cook until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with parsley, and serve.

recipes.title: Italian Cannellini Bean and Swiss Chard Soup
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sautÃ© until onion is soft.
Add tomatoes, banana squash, Swiss chard, and Italian seasoning, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in cannellini beans, vegetable broth, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, topped with grated parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Southern Buttermilk Biscuits
instructions: Preheat oven to 425Â°F (220Â°C).
In a bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Cut in shortening and butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in buttermilk, egg, and honey until just moistened.
Turn onto a floured surface; knead gently 3-4 times. Roll out to 1/2-inch thickness; cut with a floured 2-inch biscuit cutter.
Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.

recipes.title: Italian Chicken Piccata
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 cup fat free less sodium chicken broth
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until golden on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
Add balsamic vinegar to the skillet, stir to loosen browned bits. Add chicken broth and lemon juice, bring to a boil.
Return chicken to the skillet, add capers, and simmer for 5 minutes, until chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with parsley and serve.

recipes.title: Greek Lamb Gyros with Tzatziki Sauce
instructions: Marinate lamb with oregano, mint, dill, minced garlic, olive oil, red wine, salt, and pepper for at least 30 minutes.
Cook lamb in a skillet over medium heat until browned and cooked through.
For the Tzatziki sauce, mix yogurt, grated cucumber, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Chill until ready to use.
Warm pita bread, then fill with cooked lamb, tzatziki sauce, tomato slices, and onion.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Korean Sesame Kale Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 bunch kale, stems removed and leaves chopped
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add chopped kale and stir-fry for about 2 minutes.
Add water and soy sauce, cover, and let steam until the kale is tender, about 5 minutes.
Serve hot as a side dish.

recipes.title: Mexican Jalapeno Pepper Slices
instructions: Heat canola oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add jalapeno slices and sautÃ© until they start to soften and brown slightly, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve as a condiment or side dish.

recipes.title: French Maple Custard
instructions: Preheat oven to 325Â°F (165Â°C).
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, sugar, corn starch, and melted margarine until smooth.
Stir in milk, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Pour mixture into ramekins or a custard dish.
Place ramekins in a baking dish and fill the dish with hot water halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
Bake for 35 minutes or until set.
Cool slightly before serving.

recipes.title: French Pear and Cream Pastry
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Roll out puff pastry and cut into 4 equal squares. Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Arrange pear slices neatly on each pastry square.
In a bowl, mix melted butter, sugar, and pancake syrup. Brush over the pears.
Bake for 20 minutes or until pastry is puffed and golden.
Whip heavy cream until stiff peaks form, then fold in sour cream.
Serve pastries warm topped with cream mixture and dusted with confectioners' sugar.

recipes.title: Mexican Black Bean and Rice Burritos
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, jalapeno, and bell pepper. Saute until softened.
Add black beans, tomatoes, chili powder, and cooked rice. Cook until heated through.
Stir in lime juice and season with salt.
Warm tortillas, then divide the rice and bean mixture among them. Roll up tightly.
Serve garnished with fresh cilantro.

recipes.title: Italian Mushroom and Fava Bean Frittata
ingredients: 1 cup fava beans, shelled and cooked
Salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
In a large oven-safe skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms and saute until golden.
Add fava beans and cook for another 2 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, egg whites, sour cream, cheese, parsley, tarragon, salt, and pepper.
Pour the egg mixture over the mushrooms and beans in the skillet. Cook for about 5 minutes until the edges start to set.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 15 minutes or until the frittata is set.
Slice and serve warm.

recipes.title: Mexican Orzo and Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 cup orzo pasta, cooked and cooled
1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 oz) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked orzo, black beans, kidney beans, chickpeas, corn, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, and purple onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, canola oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.title: Southern Vinegar Braised Pork Chops
instructions: Season pork chops with salt and thyme.
In a large skillet, brown the pork chops on both sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add onions and garlic, and sautÃ© until onions are translucent.
Return the pork chops to the skillet. Add water and vinegar.
Cover and simmer over low heat for about 45 minutes, or until the pork chops are tender.
Serve the pork chops with the onion and vinegar sauce.

recipes.title: Italian Lemon Sponge Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease and flour an 8-inch cake pan.
In a large bowl, beat egg yolks and sugar until light and fluffy. Stir in lemon zest.
In another bowl, beat egg whites and salt to stiff peaks.
Gently fold the egg whites into the yolk mixture. Sift the flour over the egg mixture and fold in gently until just combined.
Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

recipes.title: Japanese Shrimp Sushi Rolls with Avocado and Cucumber
ingredients: 1 cup sticky rice, cooked and seasoned with rice vinegar and sugar
Wasabi paste, soy sauce, and white sesame seeds for serving
instructions: Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat.
Spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a small margin at the top and bottom.
Arrange shrimp, avocado, cucumber, and red bell pepper in a line down the center of the rice.
Roll the sushi tightly using the mat, then slice into 6-8 pieces using a sharp knife.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi paste, and sprinkled with white sesame seeds.

recipes.title: Italian Broccoli Almondine
ingredients: 1 large head of broccoli, cut into florets
instructions: Steam broccoli until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
In a skillet, toast chopped almonds until golden. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add olive oil, bread crumbs, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Stir until breadcrumbs are golden brown.
Add broccoli to the skillet, toss with breadcrumbs, then top with toasted almonds and Parmesan cheese.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Southern Pecan Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
In a large bowl, mix eggs, sugar, corn syrup, melted butter, vanilla extract, and salt until well blended.
Stir in pecan halves.
Pour the filling into the pie crust.
Bake for about 50-60 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
Allow to cool before serving.

recipes.title: Southern Blackberry Whiskey Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease and flour a cake pan.
In a large bowl, cream together melted butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Mix in eggs one at a time. Stir in lime juice and whiskey.
In another bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add to the wet ingredients, alternating with buttermilk, beginning and ending with the flour mixture.
Fold in blackberries and mint.
Pour batter into prepared cake pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

recipes.title: Italian Potato Gnocchi
instructions: Mash boiled potatoes until smooth. Allow to cool slightly.
Mix in beaten eggs, all-purpose flour, self-rising flour, and salt to form a soft dough.
On a floured surface, roll dough into long ropes, then cut into small pieces.
Press each piece against the tines of a fork to form ridges.
Boil gnocchi in salted water until they float to the surface, then remove with a slotted spoon.
Serve with your favorite pasta sauce and extra Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Jamaican Jerk Chicken Drumsticks
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, combine jerk seasoning, vinegar, olive oil, melted butter, pineapple preserves, garlic, brown sugar, salt, and pepper.
Add chicken drumsticks to the marinade and toss to coat. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat grill or oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Place marinated chicken on the grill or in a baking dish. Cook for about 30-40 minutes, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and the skin is crispy.
Serve hot, garnished with diced red bell pepper and purple onion.

recipes.title: Italian Grilled Chicken and Eggplant Pitas
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Spray eggplant slices with cooking spray and grill until tender and marked, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Grill chicken until cooked through, about 6-7 minutes per side. Slice thinly.
To assemble, fill each pita half with grilled chicken, eggplant, tomato slices, and goat cheese.
